snippet: The director of two documentaries about human rights abuses in Guatemala said that she planned to correct inaccuracies in those films, The Associated Press reported.
abstract: Pamela Yates, director of documentary films When the Mountains Tremble and Granito: How to Nail a Dictator, both of which address human rights abuses in Guatemala, says she will correct inaccuracies in those films, including blaming country's military for village massacre.
lead_paragraph: The director of two documentaries about human rights abuses in Guatemala said that she planned to correct inaccuracies in those films, The Associated Press reported.
